What is Proof of Virtue (PoV) and how does it enhance the existing Proof of Stake (PoS) algorithm in Verus?

Proof of Virtue (PoV) is a concept that enhances the existing Proof of Stake (PoS) algorithm in Verus. It introduces a new "currency" called Virtue, which is used as a trust rating of identities within the network. Virtue is tracked on a Virtue autochain and is used to weight staking contests, along with Verus stake, to determine the probability of being selected to process a block of transactions on the Verus Network.

Using a model similar to the EigenTrust algorithm, Verus will introduce the idea of Proof of
Virtue (PoV) enhancement to the PoS algorithm initially released in Phase I. In PoV, we
intend to weight staking contests with both Verus stake and “Virtue”, a special “currency”,
expected to be tracked on a Virtue autochain, and used as a trust rating of identities within
the network.
In a similar way to the “amount of stake” used when staking, Virtue will add another
component to the probability of being selected to process a block of transactions on the
Verus Network. Its probabilities upon introduction will not change returns on the Verus PoS
system, but addresses will gradually be able to improve earnings with a Virtue weighting –
based on recorded activity and behavior.
In order to ensure that Virtue is both a rare and valued property, which drives correct
behavior, it will neither be purchased, nor sold. Verus holders will have opportunities to
earn a small measure of Virtue, which can then be further increased by staking the Virtue
itself, when attesting to a fact for the network, validating information, or providing another
measurable benefit to the network.
Since Virtue will have intrinsic value on the Verus network, there will be methods for
transferring it through wallet ownership – for cases of probate or other necessity – but such
behavior as a tool for trading in virtue will not provide a secure or intended method of

How does Virtue affect the probability of being selected to process a block of transactions in Verus?

Virtue adds another component to the probability of being selected to process a block of transactions on the Verus Network. The more Virtue an address has, the higher its probability of being selected. Initially, the introduction of Virtue will not change the returns on the Verus PoS system, but addresses will gradually be able to improve their earnings with a Virtue weighting based on their recorded activity and behavior.

Using a model similar to the EigenTrust algorithm, Verus will introduce the idea of Proof of
Virtue (PoV) enhancement to the PoS algorithm initially released in Phase I. In PoV, we
intend to weight staking contests with both Verus stake and “Virtue”, a special “currency”,

How can Virtue be earned in Verus?

Virtue can be earned in Verus by staking the Virtue itself, when attesting to a fact for the network, validating information, or providing another measurable benefit to the network. Additionally, Verus holders will have opportunities to earn a small measure of Virtue, which can then be further increased through these means.

Virtue (PoV) enhancement to the PoS algorithm initially released in Phase I. In PoV, we

Can Virtue be purchased or sold in Verus?

No, Virtue cannot be purchased or sold in Verus. It is designed to be a rare and valued property that drives correct behavior, and its value lies in its intrinsic value on the Verus network. While there will be methods for transferring Virtue through wallet ownership in cases of probate or other necessity, using Virtue as a tool for trading will not provide a secure or intended method of increasing one's Virtue.
